Game Jam 2025.description: The Game Jam is a week long beginner-friendly competition between developers on creating a game. It is open to all CSI and Brooklyn College students and majors.

Event Schedule.description: This in-person meeting is highly encouraged for all participants, as it will provide essential information about the event, including the theme announcement, rules, and guidelines. It's also an excellent opportunity to meet fellow developers, form teams, and ask any questions you might have before the competition begins.

This workshop, scheduled from 12:00 PM to 1:00 PM, is designed to help participants enhance their collaborative development skills using GitHub. Attendees will learn how to effectively manage version control, collaborate with teammates, resolve merge conflicts, and follow best practices for team projects. It's ideal for both beginners and those looking to refine their skills before diving into the Game Jam.

he Game Jam officially kicks off at 2:00 PM, marking the start of an exciting event! Participants will work in teams or solo to create innovative games based on the announced theme. This is your opportunity to showcase creativity, technical skills, and teamwork. Make sure to manage your time effectively and have fun while bringing your game ideas to life

The Game Jam will conclude at 2:00 PM on January 23rd. Once the clock hits zero, judging will begin! All games will be reviewed by a panel of experts based on creativity, gameplay, design, and adherence to the theme. It's time to showcase your hard work and see how your game measures up. Get ready for an exciting reveal of the winners!

The final day of judging will take place on January 24th. The panel will finish evaluating all the games based on creativity, technical execution, and overall gameplay experience. Participants can expect to hear the results and see the winning games announced shortly afterward. It's the last chance to see how your hard work is assessed, and the excitement is building up for the grand reveal!

Judging Criteria.description: The game prompts players to interact with it and provides rules and features that allow them to understand the game goals.
The game should include novel or unique aspects, either through a truly new concept or a novel application of an existing concept or concepts.
The game should clearly demonstrate through concept, gameplay, story, or characters, the prompt/concept.
While not all future development must be shown during the jam, plans for future expansion of the game or multiple varied gameplay features should be presented.
The team presents their proposed game clearly to the audience through a 5-minute video presentation.
